title: The world's end movie logo
content:
Tried both WhatTheFont and WhatFontIs with different letter combos but nothing even close emerged.  
It looks familiar though.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601im_/http:/typophile.com/files/5_5985.jpg)

Font: 

 Grusskarten Gotisch 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [5.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/typophile.com/files/5_15.jpg) | 13.15 KB |
author: akovia

comments.content:
The closest I have is [Grusskarten Gotisch](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/g/grussgot.htm) by Dieter Steffmann, mainly cleaning up /T from flourishes (keeping skeleton) and recreating this swashy /Th flourish/ligature.  
More alternatives: [Ruca URW++](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/ruca), [Ardenwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/ardenwood), [Black Swan BF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/black-swan), [Xanthippe NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/xanthippe-nf), [Courtrai](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/courtrai), [Skjend Hans Gotisk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/www.dafont.com/skjend-hans-gotisk.font), [Duerer Gotisch](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055601/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/d/duerergot.htm)

Thanks Ryuk!  
I used it as a base. It was a very close match indeed.
